page.title: 14STEWARTON'S HEALTH SERVICE
page.content: Stewarton's new Health Centre houses the combined practices of 5 doctors- Dr Tom Duke, Dr Peter Howie, Dr Ken Hambly, Dr David Hunter and Dr John Duke. There is another doctor in Main Street- Dr Peter McGeechan. The nursing service and child welfare also have rooms in the centre. There are 2 dentists, one in Avenue Street,Mr C.J. Boyle and the other in Corsehillbank Street, Mrs Liz Leggate. Stewarton has newly formed group-Friends of the Hospice helping to set up a hospice in the district. Doctor, dentist and nurses visit the schools regularly. The Blood Transfusion van also visits the town twice a year. People from Stewarton also help as volunteers at Crosshouse Hospital in the visitors' canteens.
